content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function to extract Julia code from a markdown document:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Regex for Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block_regex = r"```julia\n(.*?)```"ms

    # Find all code blocks and join them
    code_blocks = matchall(julia_code_block_regex, md)
    extracted_code = join(map(m -> replace(m[1], r"^```julia\n|```$", ""), code_blocks), "\n\n")

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function takes a markdown document as a string and uses a regex to find all Julia code blocks (with triple backticks and "julia" as the language identifier). It then removes the code fences and joins all the code blocks together with a double newline. Finally, it returns the extracted Julia code as a string.

You can copy and paste this function into your Julia environment or script.
